Appearance
Frae Wikipedia, the free beuk o knawledge
Walcome tae Wikipaedia,
the free encyclopaedia that awbody can eedit.
This Scots edeetion wis shapit on 23rd Juin 2005. We hae 34,287 airticles the nou.

Monanday 6 October 2025

Annuncements · Owerview FAQ · Mercat Cross · Commonty Yett · Writin Scots Lessons · Help dask · Contact us

 Featurt airticle

The village o Findhorn is fund on the north-east shore o the Findhorn bay an mouth o the Findhorn river, 30 mile east frae Innerness.

Watson (1926) kens the name is frae Fionn Èire, meanin white Ireland an it "doubtless refers tae the white sands o the estuary". The dative Èireann gied rise tae the uiss o the Inglis erne in ither local names sic as Invererne, Cullerne an Earnhill.

Its it mair likely that the name is frae the Pictish spoken in the area. The Pict-Scot union o 843 brought in Gaelic, Maxwell (1896) kens the Fin is frae the Pictish Pit, as in Pitlochery. The orn is simply 'river', frae the Scots Gaelic abhainn, an Auld Welsh afon. The Gaelic influence wis soon cowped by the sons o Malcolm Canmore who brocht in an ancestor o moderen Scots tung frae the Northumbrian bylied. Ken the lack o places stairtin wi Fin- an Pit- in the Gaelic speakin regions o the wast coast.

Fowk hae bed aroond Findhorn frae mair nor three thousan year. In 1986 biggin work kythed a clay burial urn containin the remains o a quine o twenty five year an her bairn.

 Featurt pictur


Fochabers veelage, beside the River Spey, in Moray.

Eemage: Qeqertaq

  • Paddy Higson, Scots film producer an production owerseer

 Did ye ken...

Frae a collection o Wikipedia's airticles:

  • ... that Scott Manley (picturt) wis a consultant on the scrievin o The Skies of Pern?
  • ... that the lest pistol duel in Scotland happent in Auchtertool?
  • ... that the seed husks o Plantago can be aet tae sort out yer dry darn?
  • ... that Oor Wullie's paw is cried Tam?
  • ... that Marco Polo met wi Kublai Khan, the heid chief o the Mongols?

 On this day

6 October:

  • 1973 – Arab–Israeli conflict: Egyp launches a coordinatit attack wi Sirie against Israel leadin tae the Yom Kippur War.
  • 1979 – Pape John Paul II acomes the first pontiff tae veesit the White House.
  • 1981 – Egyptian Presies Anwar Sadat (picturt) is murthert bi Islamic extremists.
  • 1995 – The star, 51 Pegasi, is diskivert tae be the seicont major starn apairt frae the Sun tae hae a planet orbitin aroond it.
  • 2010 – Instagram, a mainstream photo-sharin application, is foondit bi Kevin Systrom an Mike Krieger.

images.desc:
Featurt airticle

The village o Findhorn is fund on the north-east shore o the Findhorn bay an mouth o the Findhorn river, 30 mile east frae Innerness.

Watson (1926) kens the name is frae Fionn Èire, meanin white Ireland an it "doubtless refers tae the white sands o the estuary". The dative Èireann gied rise tae the uiss o the Inglis erne in ither local names sic as Invererne, Cullerne an Earnhill.

Its it mair likely that the name is frae the Pictish spoken in the area. The Pict-Scot union o 843 brought in Gaelic, Maxwell (1896) kens the Fin is frae the Pictish Pit, as in Pitlochery. The orn is simply 'river', frae the Scots Gaelic abhainn, an Auld Welsh afon. The Gaelic influence wis soon cowped by the sons o Malcolm Canmore who brocht in an ancestor o moderen Scots tung frae the Northumbrian bylied. Ken the lack o places stairtin wi Fin- an Pit- in the Gaelic speakin regions o the wast coast.

Fowk hae bed aroond Findhorn frae mair nor three thousan year. In 1986 biggin work kythed a clay burial urn containin the remains o a quine o twenty five year an her bairn.

On this day
6 October:



1973 – Arab–Israeli conflict: Egyp launches a coordinatit attack wi Sirie against Israel leadin tae the Yom Kippur War.
1979 – Pape John Paul II acomes the first pontiff tae veesit the White House.
1981 – Egyptian Presies Anwar Sadat (picturt) is murthert bi Islamic extremists.
1995 – The star, 51 Pegasi, is diskivert tae be the seicont major starn apairt frae the Sun tae hae a planet orbitin aroond it.
2010 – Instagram, a mainstream photo-sharin application, is foondit bi Kevin Systrom an Mike Krieger.
Hafez al-Assad (b. 1930) ·  Anwar Sadat (d. 1981) ·  Bette Davis (d. 1989)

## [![Featurt airticle](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a5/Nuvola_apps_bookcase.svg/20px-Nuvola_apps_bookcase.svg.png)](https://sco.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Featurt_airticle "Featurt airticle")
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/13/Findhorn.jpg/250px-Findhorn.jpg)](https://sco.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Findhorn.jpg)
The village o **[Findhorn](https://sco.wikipedia.org/wiki/Findhorn "Findhorn")** is fund on the north-east shore o the Findhorn bay an mouth o the Findhorn river, 30 mile east frae [Innerness](https://sco.wikipedia.org/wiki/Innerness "Innerness").
Watson (1926) kens the name is frae _Fionn Èire_ , meanin _white Ireland_ an it "doubtless refers tae the white sands o the estuary". The dative _Èireann_ gied rise tae the uiss o the Inglis _erne_ in ither local names sic as Invererne, Cullerne an Earnhill.
Its it mair likely that the name is frae the Pictish spoken in the area. The Pict-Scot union o 843 brought in Gaelic, Maxwell (1896) kens the _Fin_ is frae the Pictish _Pit_ , as in _Pitlochery_. The _orn_ is simply 'river', frae the Scots Gaelic _abhainn_ , an Auld Welsh _afon_. The Gaelic influence wis soon cowped by the sons o [Malcolm Canmore](https://sco.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malcolm_III_o_Scotland "Malcolm III o Scotland") who brocht in an ancestor o moderen Scots tung frae the Northumbrian bylied. Ken the lack o places stairtin wi _Fin-_ an _Pit-_ in the Gaelic speakin regions o the wast coast.
Fowk hae bed aroond Findhorn frae mair nor three thousan year. In 1986 biggin work kythed a clay burial urn containin the remains o a quine o twenty five year an her bairn.

## ![Featurt airticle⟨51⟩](https://sco.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Featurt_airticle "Featurt airticle")
![⟨52⟩](https://sco.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Findhorn.jpg)
The village o **Findhorn⟨53⟩** is fund on the north-east shore o the Findhorn bay an mouth o the Findhorn river, 30 mile east frae Innerness⟨54⟩.
Watson (1926) kens the name is frae _Fionn Èire_ , meanin _white Ireland_ an it "doubtless refers tae the white sands o the estuary". The dative _Èireann_ gied rise tae the uiss o the Inglis _erne_ in ither local names sic as Invererne, Cullerne an Earnhill.
Its it mair likely that the name is frae the Pictish spoken in the area. The Pict-Scot union o 843 brought in Gaelic, Maxwell (1896) kens the _Fin_ is frae the Pictish _Pit_ , as in _Pitlochery_. The _orn_ is simply 'river', frae the Scots Gaelic _abhainn_ , an Auld Welsh _afon_. The Gaelic influence wis soon cowped by the sons o Malcolm Canmore⟨55⟩ who brocht in an ancestor o moderen Scots tung frae the Northumbrian bylied. Ken the lack o places stairtin wi _Fin-_ an _Pit-_ in the Gaelic speakin regions o the wast coast.
Fowk hae bed aroond Findhorn frae mair nor three thousan year. In 1986 biggin work kythed a clay burial urn containin the remains o a quine o twenty five year an her bairn.
